# Liver Function Tests

Liver function tests are a panel, usually with most of:

* **Bilirubin**\
Haeme metabolite, conjugated in the liver.
* **Albumin**\
Hepatically synthesised plasma protein, half-life of ~20 days.
* **Total protein**\
Sum of all plasma proteins (not all hepatically synthesised), including: albumin, immunoglobulins, and carrier proteins.
* **GGT**\
From *biliary* hepatocyte.
* **ALP**\
From *biliary* hepatocyte, bone (during formation), intestine, and placenta.
* **AST**\
From hepatocyte *cytoplasm*, and muscle.
* **ALT**\
From hepatocyte *cytoplasm*.


## Interpretation

+-------------+---------------+------------------------------+
| Pattern     | Presentation  | Causes                       |
+=============+===============+==============================+
| Cholestatic | - ALP >200    | - Biliary obstruction        |
|             | - ALP >3x AST | - Malignancy                 |
|             |               | - Pregnancy                  |
|             |               | - Drugs                      |
+-------------+---------------+------------------------------+
| Hepatitic   | - ALT >200    | - Hepatocellular destruction |
|             | - ALT >3x ALP | - Hepatitis                  |
|             |               | - EBV                        |
|             |               | - CMV                        |
|             |               | - Alcohol                    |
|             |               | - Drugs                      |
|             |               | - Metal overload             |
|             |               | - Autoimmune                 |
+-------------+---------------+------------------------------+
